clinical_study.brief_title: Evaluation of Postnatal Outcomes of Covid 19 Positive Mothers Newborns
clinical_study.official_title: Postnatal Outcomes of Covid 19 Positive Mothers Newborns

lead_sponsor.agency: Kanuni Sultan Suleyman Training and Research Hospital

clinical_study.source: Kanuni Sultan Suleyman Training and Research Hospital

brief_summary.textblock:
Evaluation of apgar, hemogram and developmental status of babies born from covid 19 positive
      mothers

primary_outcome.measure: Evaluation of apgar status of newborns from covid 19 positive mothers
primary_outcome.description:
The Apgar score is looked after at 1 and 5 minutes after birth, if the baby's Apgar score is lower than 7, it is repeated every 5 minutes until 20 minutes. Parameters examined in Apgar score Muscle tone, Heart rate, Reflexes, Skin color, Respiration.
In the Apgar score, the baby is evaluated and scores are collected.
7 - 10: The baby is normal.
4 - 6: They usually recover with respiratory support.
0 - 3: Urgent intervention and resuscitation is needed.
The low Apgar score in the 1st minute usually returns to normal in the 5th minute with support. Despite the intervention, the Apgar scores of 5 and less at 5 and 10 minutes are associated with an increased risk of mortality and cerebral palsy.

intervention.description: Evaluation of apgar, hemogram and developmental status of babies born from covid 19 positive mothers

study_pop.textblock:
Evaluation of apgar, hemogram and developmental status of babies born from covid 19
        positive mothers

criteria.textblock:
Inclusion Criteria:

          -  from covid 19 positive mothers

          -  newborn mothers had not other condition or illness

        Exclusion Criteria:

          -  from covid 19 negative mothers

          -  childs

responsible_party.investigator_affiliation: Kanuni Sultan Suleyman Training and Research Hospital
